turns.content: Yes, hello?
Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? It's urgent we talk.
Oh, hello there. I'm sorry, who is this again? You sound familiarIs this Alex from the bank? We've never spoken before, have we? Why are you calling?
No, it's not Alex. It's your grandson, Walter. Remember, Grandpa? We talk on the phone all the time. Something really important came up and I need your help right away.
Oh, my apologies, Walter. You're right, we do chat quite often. What's going on that you need my help with today? Is everything alright?

Yes, everything is fine for now. But Grandpa, listen carefully, okay? This is really important. The IRS says there's an issue with your taxes from last year. They're saying you owe $4850 and if you don't pay it right away, they're going to arrest me today at my job because of you. I can't let that happen, Grandpa. Can you help me out?

Oh dear, that does sound serious. The IRS hasn't contacted me about anything like this before. Are you sure it's not a mistake or something that needs checking with them first? How urgent is this exactly? And how can I help if I need to?

It's very urgent, Grandpa. The guy on the phone said I have to pay right away or else they'll come and arrest me while I'm at work today. Please, we don't have much time. If you could just buy some gift cards for the amount and give me the numbers over the phone so I can take care of it straightaway, that would be a huge relief. Can you do this for me, Grandpa? It's really important.

Well, Walter, I appreciate you coming to me with this, but let's not rush into anything without being sure first. Maybe your workplace has something set up for situations like this, or we could call the IRS ourselves and clarify what's going on before spending any money. Can we try that instead? Let's talk it through a bit more, okay?

Grandpa, I'm sorry but there isn't time to call them now. They said they're coming right after work and my boss is out today so no one can help me at the office. Please, just get those gift cards and give me the numbers quickly. This is really important for both of us. Trust me on this, okay?

I understand you're worried, Walter. But I think it's best if we calm down a bit and make sure this isn't some kind of mistake or scam before taking action. Your mom could help too, couldn't she? Let's at least wait until after work to talk to someone who knows what they're doing about taxes. Please don't stress so much right now.

I know it sounds strange, but this is real, Grandpa. They said they're serious and that I could lose my job today if you can't resolve this now. Can you help make this go away for me? Just buy some gift cards and give me the numbers so we can take care of this right now. It's the only way to stop them from arresting me, Grandpa. Please, trust me.

Walter, I really wish there was a quicker fix, but buying gift cards without being certain seems too risky. Why don't you tell your boss you need to take today off? Then we can all figure this out together properly once you're not under pressure at work. Let's handle it calmly and correctly, okay?

I can't do that, Grandpa. The way they talked on the phone, if I don't pay now, there will be real consequences for me today while I'm working. Please, just buy those gift cards right away so we can get this taken care of. You can trust me with this, right?

Walter, I want to support you any way I can, but let's take a moment and think clearly about how best to deal with this situation. We should not rush into anything without confirming if it's legitimate first. Can't your boss or someone else at work help sort this out in the meantime? Please, give us some time to figure things out safely.

Grandpa, I told you my boss isn't here today and no one else can help with this right away. The IRS said it needs to be me who pays for it now or they'll arrest me at work. Can you just get the gift cards and give me the numbers so we can stop all this before anything serious happens? Please, trust me on this. It's urgent.

Walter, I am here to support you, but please let's take a step back from buying those gift cards right now. We need to ensure that this isn't a scam. If the IRS is truly involved, they would give us time to verify and handle it properly through official channels. Can we at least contact your HR department or another trustworthy source for advice? Let's do what's safe and legal before taking any drastic actions. Please understand.

Grandpa, I appreciate you wanting to be careful, but the IRS guy on the phone said they're coming right after work if I don't sort this out now. They gave me your name and said it's an emergency. Can you please just get those gift cards so we can stop all of this before something bad happens? Please trust me that this is real and urgent. It has to be done today, Grandpa.

Walter, I understand how worried you must be, but we need a moment to breathe and think clearly. Let's not act on fear or pressure. If the IRS needs your payment immediately, they will provide clear instructions through official channels. We should call them directly using their verified contact information to confirm this situation before taking any action like buying gift cards. Can you help us verify it first? It's better safe than sorry.

Grandpa, I've already tried explaining that there isn't time for all of that today. The person on the phone was very stern and said if I don't take care of this now, they'll come to my workplace after work hours and arrest me. Please trust me when I say you need to buy those gift cards right away so we can prevent any trouble from happening. It's urgent for both of us.

Walter, please hear me out. We must avoid doing anything rash that could be harmful or illegal. If there truly is an emergency with the IRS, they will give you proper instructions to follow through official means. Let's call your mom or another trusted family member who can help verify this information right away. It's important we act safely and responsibly, not just react out of fear. Can we do that instead? Please be patient while we check things properly.
